traits.calling_and_family: Called by Jesus while mending nets with his brother John and their father Zebedee, leaving their boat and hired men to follow him.
traits.sons_of_thunder: Together with John, given the name Boanerges, 'sons of thunder,' hinting at a fiery or forceful temperament.
traits.inner_circle: Belongs to the inner trio (with Peter and John) present at key moments such as the raising of Jairus’s daughter, the transfiguration, and Gethsemane.
traits.ambition_and_misunderstanding: Along with John, requests seats at Jesus’s right and left in glory, provoking indignation among the others and prompting Jesus’s teaching on servant leadership.

traits.call_and_role: Called with John from the boat of Zebedee and listed among the Twelve, paired with his brother.
traits.family_request_for_honor: In Matthew’s version, their mother (the mother of the sons of Zebedee) asks that they sit at Jesus’s right and left in his kingdom, revealing family ambition and misunderstanding of greatness.
traits.presence_in_key_scenes: Included with Peter and John at the transfiguration and at Gethsemane, marking him as part of Jesus’s closest circle.

traits.fisherman_disciple: Implicitly associated with the Zebedee fishing business in the call narrative where partners of Simon are astonished at the catch.
traits.selection_as_apostle: Named among those whom Jesus designates as apostles after a night of prayer.
traits.inner_circle_participation: Appears with Peter and John at the transfiguration and is mentioned when a Samaritan village rejects Jesus, a context sometimes linked to the 'sons of thunder' reputation.
traits.martyrdom_in_acts: Acts notes that Herod Agrippa I kills James the brother of John with the sword, making him the first of the Twelve to be martyred.
traits.narrative_profile: Combines early prominence within Jesus’s ministry with a brief but significant notice of martyrdom in the early church.
